page.lettertext:
fol.13r
May it please yo
r
good L. There is order
here taken, for a Rendevous of
e forces of
these contreis, to be made in certaine places
of
e Betuwe and Veluwe, and all to be
assembled
e 14 of this moneth. I have sent
yo
r
L. heere a list of
e severall nombers,
that are accorded to be drawen out of every
Province. A fewe daies past
e
house of
Westerloo
in
Brabant,
adjoining to
Herentals,
a place of some strength, and apper-
tening to
e
Baron of Merode
, was surprised
by
e souldiers of
Breda.
Yonge Merode
e
sonne, by whome
e house was kept, was ridden
abroad a hunting, whereby they missed of his
person. Howbeit
e place was taken by a 120
souldiers, who continue in it still, and would
willingly keepe it, against
e force of
e Enemie.
For it li eth very fitly w
t
a marishe about it,
that
e Enemie can not easely approche w
t
any batterie. But heere is no resolution
yet taken, whether it shall be held, or aban-
doned. Also of late there have issued
certaine troupes of Breda, to
e nomber of 300
horse, and have defeated
e horse company of
e
Count of Arrembergh
, w
ch
was 200 strong,
and lay in
to
e contrey of
Valkenbourgh
, neere
to
Aquisgrave:
wherof o
r
souldiers had intelli-
gence by two brethren, w
ch
being wronged
by
e Enemie, sought to be revenged, by ge-
ving secret notice both of
e meanes, and of
fol.13v
e place, to assault them unwares. Besides
those
at were slaine, there are brought to Breda,
about 60 horses of service, and 18 prisoners.
Moreover there hath bin of late a hotte encounter,
between
e Ligeois, and
e mutins of
Diest:
in
w
ch
were slaine a 150 Spaniardes, and of
Liege
300 and
e rest putt to flight. Heere is
very good hope,
at
e quarel thus begonne,
will be hardly taken up: w
ch
will come the
Enemie ill to passe, considering his affaires
have so many other crosses, w
ch
, as we are in-
formed, increase every day, by their civil dis-
sention.
Having no other mater to advertise
yo
r
L. I take my humble leave.
From
e Hage. May 5 1591.
Yo
r
L. most humbly bounden Tho. Bodley
